page.title: 12Ecology around Harberton
page.content: Local people seem to take a conservative attitude towards the land, disliking much change. The Devon hedgerows are particularly appreciated, always alive with a succession of wild flowers throughout the year. Snowdrops, primroses, daffodils, bluebells, campions, foxgloves, wild orchids and roses, and honeysuckle, flower naturally throughout the area, to everyone's delight. The recent scurge of Dutch Elm Disease has changed the landscape as it has meant the felling of practically all the elms in the area. A policy of replanting has encouraged the replacement with a variety of deciduous saplings.
